Contributor: Wilson, W. N., artist.; Victory Liberty Loan Committee.;
Note: Signed "W.N. Wilson." Date based on the date of the Victory Liberty Loan campaign. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Design for a newspaper and magazine advertisement for the Victory Liberty Loan campaign.  The text tells about George Dilboy, Private, First Class, Co. H, 103rd Infantry.  He received an official citation for gallantry because, with several bullet holes in his body, he continued to fire at the enemy in a battle at Belleau, France.  Americans are asked to continue showing the same spirit as Dilboy by investing in the Victory Liberty Loan.  Illustration shows the soldier standing on tracks aiming his rifle.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I

Title: America's immortals : George Dilboy.
